message: Hi, were working on a service which hooks up to Twitters API and there are a few points in their T&C's that we need clarifying - does anyone know of a good legal expert who has had experience with Twitter? or other social blog/networks.

you should ask Twitter... it's more important to be in compliance with the spirit of the T&C, as Twitter understands it, than just the letter some 3rd party could interpret... Twitter could always change the T&C out from under you... and they often have some pretty elastic/open-to-interpretation clauses anyway
Just looked at http://dev.twitter.com/pages/api_terms --- the termination clause does indeed let them terminate "for any reason".  The rest is guidelines, and need to be understood as such.
